prompt_text: High-detail realistic illustration of the species Correlophus ciliatus (Crested Gecko). Show correct anatomy: fringe crest along head and back, prehensile tail, four limbs each with five toes and adhesive lamellae. Natural earth-brown and moss-green hues, perched on a branch with soft diffused daylight lighting, clean beige background.

Realistic detailed illustration of the species Eublepharis macularius (Leopard Gecko). Show its eyelids (distinctive of this genus), spotted pattern yellow-cream and black, four limbs each with five toes, thick tail. Sitting on warm sand substrate, matte finish, soft daylight, neutral background.

Realistic illustration of the species Gekko gecko (Tokay Gecko). Show orange-blue spotted pattern over turquoise-grey body, large sticky toe pads, strong limbs, correct anatomy, perched on bark with gentle shadow, clean background, natural lighting, matte texture.

Detailed realistic illustration of Rhacodactylus auriculatus (Gargoyle Gecko). Show head ridges (‘horns’), marbled pattern in warm earth-brown and muted greens, correct limb and toe count (five toes each), long prehensile tail. On branch or rock, soft daylight, matte, neutral background.

Realistic illustration of Phelsuma madagascariensis (Madagascar Day Gecko). Show bright green body with red stripe behind eye, slender limbs, sticky pads, five toes each, long tail, diurnal pose in daylight, on leaf surface, matte style, clean beige background.

High-detail realistic illustration of the species Hemitheconyx caudicinctus (African Fat-Tail Gecko). Show fat tail (storage), eyelids present, spotted beige/brown pattern, correct limb/ toe count, on sandy substrate, warm natural lighting, clean background, matte texture.

Realistic illustration of the species Hemidactylus frenatus (Common House Gecko). Show scale texture, correct anatomy, slender body, climbing vertical surface, nocturnal lighting but still neutral background, authentic colouration grey-brown, adhesive toe pads visible, soft daylight variant, matte finish.
